snippet: Law enforcement officials appealed to the public to help find Hayat Boumeddiene, the girlfriend of Amedy Coulibaly, who took hostages at a kosher supermarket.
abstract: French Prime Min Manuel Valls declares France is at war with radical Islam and urges citizens to attend planned rally in Paris to affirm country's secular values; authorities are still on high alert in wake of terrorist attacks and in anticipation of unity rally; security forces are still searching for Hayat Boumeddiene, who is suspected of having played role in attacks and is believed to have fled to Syria through Turkey.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and MAÏA de la BAUME
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials appealed to the public to help find Hayat Boumeddiene, the girlfriend of Amedy Coulibaly, who took hostages at a kosher supermarket.

headline.main: French Premier Declares ‘War’ on Radical Islam as Paris Girds for Rally
headline.print_headline: Paris Is on High Alert Ahead of a Giant Unity Rally
